メガシンカで　こどもが　せいちょう。\nまけんきばかりが　つよく　ははおやは\nしょうらいが　すこし　しんぱい。
ばくはつてきな　エネルギーを　あびた\nこどもが　いちじてきに　せいちょう。\nははおやは　きが　きでは　ない。
メガシンカした　この　せなかを　みた\nははおやは　いずれ　おとずれる\nわかれのひに　おもいを　はせるのだ。
メガシンカの　えいきょうで　つねに\nこうふん。　２ほんの　おおヅノで\nてきを　さしつらぬいてから　ひきさく。
メガシンカの　エネルギーを　あびて\nはねが　いじょうに　はったつした。\nおよそ　じそく　５０キロで　とぶ。
メガシンカし　とべるように　なった。\nよほど　うれしいのか　めったに\nちじょうには　おりてこないぞ。
もうスピードで　とびまわり　あいての\nすきを　ねらっている。　きょだいな\nハサミで　くしざしにする　つもりだ。
メガシンカが　のうにも　さよう。\nすべてを　やきつくす　はかいの\nほんのうしか　のこっていない。
からだの　わきの　ふんしゃこう　から\nみずを　ふきだし　すいめんへ　とぶ。\nそのスピードは　マッハを　こえるぞ。
メガシンカで　からだに　ふたんが\nかかっている。　ストレスで　いっそう\nきょうぼうに　あばれまわるのだ。
マッハの　そくどで　すいちゅう　から\nとびだす。　まきこまれれば　おおきな\nふねも　まっぷたつに　へしおれるぞ。
からだの　いちぶが　いしに　なった。\nこのすがたが　しんの　プテラであると\nしゅちょうする　がくしゃも　いる。
メガシンカし　いぜんに　わを　かけて\nきょうぼうに。　かじょうな　パワーに\nくるしんでいるためと　いわれる。
うごくもの　すべてに　おそいかかる。\nメガシンカが　からだに　ふたんで\nとても　いらだって　いるからだ。
メガシンカに　より　うしなわれていた\nいでんしが　よみがえり　ぜんしんを\nおおう　するどい　いわが　ふっかつ。
メガシンカの　かじょうなエネルギーが\nいでんしを　しげき。　ぬけおちたはずの\nたいもうが　ふたたび　はえてきた。
ぼうだいな　エネルギーが　さいぼうを\nはげしく　しげき。　ねむっていた\nドラゴンの　ちが　めざめたらしい。
かじょうな　エネルギーを　あびて\nつねに　オーバーフローぎみ。\nちょうじかんは　たたかえないのだ。
メガシンカの　えいきょうで　ハサミは\nはさんだ　ものを　ズタズタに　さく\nきょうあくな　かたちに　へんかした。
かじょうな　メガシンカのエネルギーを\nたくわえているため　ちょうじかん\nたつと　からだが　とけはじめてしまう。
はさむより　なぐるほうが　とくい。\nながいじかん　たたかうと　ハサミの\nおもさに　たえられなくなる。
２ほんのツノで　はさみこみ　じぶんの\nたいじゅうの　５００ばいの　おもさの\nものも　もちあげることが　できるのだ。
すさまじい　エネルギーを　あびて\nビルドアップ。　メガシンカが　おわると\nひどい　きんにくつうに　なやまされる。
あかいツメや　シッポの　せんたんは\nヘルガー　じしんが　くるしむほどの\nこうおんで　すでに　とけかけている。
メガシンカで　ぜんしんが　はつねつ。\nはげしい　ほのおの　いぶきを\nふきだし　あいてを　すみに　かえる。
すさまじいパワーを　ちゅうにゅうされ\nせなかが　さけて　しまった。　ただただ\nはかいする　ほんのうのみで　うごく。
メガシンカの　えいきょうで　さらに\nきょうぼうに　なった。　トレーナーの\nめいれいも　きこえているか　ふめい。
ひじょうに　こうげきてきな　せいしつ。\nふたつのアゴで　えものを　はさむと\nちからまかせに　ひきちぎる。
２つの　アゴは　いしが　あるように\nはげしく　あばれまくっている。\nひとかみで　がんせきも　コナゴナだ。
メガシンカで　すさまじい　りょうの\nでんりょくが　たいないに　たまるが\nあつかいきれず　もてあましている。
からだに　でんきが　たまりすぎていて\nいらだっている。　らくらいと　おなじ\nスピードの　しゅんぱつりょくがある。
けたちがいの　エネルギーが　のろいを\nぞうふくし　おさえきれない。　じぶんの\nトレーナーさえ　うらんでしまうのだ。
メガシンカで　おんねんが　ぞうふく。\nチャックの　なかに　しまわれていた\nのろいの　パワーが　あふれだす。
つばさのように　さかだつ　たいもうを\nはばたかせて　あいてを　いあつする\nオーラを　ほとばしらせるのだ。
メガシンカの　エネルギーが　みなぎり\nぜんしんの　たいもうが　さかだつ。\nつばさでは　ないので　とべは　しない。
ほんらい　あらそいを　このまないため\nたたかいの　ための　この　すがたに\nかわることを　とても　きらっている。
メガシンカの　エネルギーを　いあつの\nオーラに　かえて　ふりまいている。\nきのよわいひとは　ショックし　する。
かじょうな　エネルギーで　りょうてと\nはねが　とけてしまい　きょだいな\nカマじょうの　かたちに　へんかした。
じまんの　はねが　カマに　なって\nいかりくるっている。　カマを　ふるって\nだいちを　みじんに　きりきざむ。
うでと　ハネが　とけ　カマの　ように\nへんかして　しまった。　いかり\nくるって　あばれに　あばれまくるぞ。
メガシンカまえ　より　きょうぼうな\nせいしつ。　りょううでの　カマで\nてきを　ズタズタに　きりきざむ。
メガシンカ　エネルギーと　はどうが\nまじりあい　かけめぐった　あとが\nぜんしんに　くろく　きざまれている。
ぜんしんけいを　しゅうちゅうして\nめのまえの　てきに　いどむ。\nたたかいぶりは　ひじょうの　ひとこと。
メガシンカで　はどうが　ぼうちょう。\nとうそうほんのうの　おもむくままに\nひじょうな　しゅだんで　てきをうつ。
ばくはつてきな　エネルギーを　あびて\nとうそうほんのうが　めざめた。　てきに\nたいして　いっさい　ようしゃしない。
もっている　はなは　いまは　どこにも\nさいていない。　そして　おそろしい\nちからを　ひめていると　おもわれる。
まがまがしい　はなには　おそろしい\nエネルギーが　ひめられているが\nそれを　むじゃきに　ふりまわしている。
メガシンカの　エネルギーは　すべて\nしっぽの　シェルダーに　そそがれた。\nそして　ヤドンは　まるのみに　された。
メガシンカの　エネルギーを　あびた\nシェルダーは　てっぺきの　よろい。\nヤドンには　とくに　へんかナシ。
すさまじい　エネルギーが　シッポの\nシェルダーの　ちからを　きょうかした。\nヤドンには　とくに　えいきょうなし。
シェルダーに　まるのみ　されて\nてっぺきの　まもりを　てに　いれた。\nなかは　けっこう　かいてき　なのだ。
メガシンカの　えいきょうを　うけて\nきょだいかした　むねの　ほうせきは\nどんな　こうげきも　はねかえす。
きょだいな　ほうせきは　おもいので\nとっさの　ほうこうてんかんは　にがて。\nうしろからの　こうげきが　じゃくてん。
メガシンカの　エネルギーを　あびた\nむねの　ほうせきは　ぼうちょうし\nひふを　ひきさいて　とびだした。
きょだいかした　ほうせきで　あらゆる\nこうげきを　ガード。　ただし　すごく\nおもたいので　うごくのは　にがて。
とうぶに　はえる　トゲは　キバが\nへんかしたもの。　きずつき　おれても\nそのばで　なんどでも　はえかわる。
メガシンカにより　とうそうほんのうが\nばくはつ。　きいろい　もようは\nかこの　れきせんの　きずあと。
きいろい　もようは　かこの　ふるきず。\nメガシンカの　エネルギーが　めぐって\nズキズキ　いたんで　くるしいらしい。
とっしんした　しゅんかん　あたまから\nするどい　トゲが　とびだし　あいての\nからだを　ふかく　きずつける。
かじょうな　メガシンカ　エネルギーが\nくちから　あふれ　アゴが　くだけた。\nつねに　ふぶきを　はいている。
くちの　なかに　えものを　ほうりこみ\nしゅんじに　こおらせるが　アゴが\nはずれているので　たべられない。
くだけた　くちから　すさまじい\nれいきを　はくと　あたり　いったいは\nホワイトアウトに　おちいってしまう。
メガシンカの　パワーが　つよすぎて\nアゴが　くだけてしまった。　うまく\nエサを　くえずに　いらだっている。
やいばのように　するどい　はねで\nゆくてを　さえぎるもの　すべてを\nまっぷたつにし　とびつづける。
より　きょうぼうに　なって　そだての\nトレーナーにも　おそいかかるほど。\nべつめい　ちに　ぬれた　みかづき。
あばれまくるのは　じまんの　２つの\nつばさが　つよい　エネルギーで\nいびつに　くっついた　ストレスのせい。
まえあしを　カラの　すきまに　のせて\nひこうたいせいを　とる。　ふくざつな\nちけいも　こうそくで　とびまわるぞ。
１ぴきの　メタグロスと　１ぴきの\nメタングと　２ひきの　ダンバルが\nれんけつ　している　すがた　なのだ。
メガシンカで　のうを　しげきされ\nしょうりの　ためには　しゅだんを\nえらばない　れいこくな　せいかくに。
さらに　すぐれた　ずのうに　なった。\nその　けっかの　たたかいは　めを\nおおいたくなるほど　れいこくだ。
かてないと　はんだんすると　ツメで\nあいてを　つかみ　だいばくはつの\nカウントを　はじめるぞ。
みみを　ムチのように　しならせて\nてきに　うちつける。　きしょうは\nはげしく　こうせんてきな　きしつ。
メガシンカに　よって　たたかいの\nほんのうが　かくせい。　こうげきの\nじゃまに　なる　けを　ぬぎすてた。
まえばで　ドアを　かじり　みんかに\nしんにゅう。　ヒゲを　ひくつかせ\nエサを　さがしだし　ぬすんでいくぞ。
ひが　くれると　かつどう。　むれの\nボスである　ラッタのため　いいエサを\nもとめて　まちじゅうを　かけめぐる。
しんせんな　ものにしか　きょうみを\nしめさない。　かいものに　つれていくと\nしょくざいえらびの　とき　たすかる。
エサを　もとめて　よなよな　みんかに\nしのびこむ。　たいりょう　はっせいが\nしゃかい　もんだいと　なっている。
コラッタを　ひきい　グループをつくる。\nグループには　テリトリーが　あり\nエサを　めぐり　こうそうに　なる。
エサの　あじと　せんどに　こだわる\nグルメな　ポケモン。　ラッタが　すむ\nレストランは　アタリと　いわれる。
とても　よくばりな　せいしつ。　すには\nコラッタたちに　あつめさせた　エサが\nたべきれないほど　たんまり　あるぞ。
コラッタたちを　ひきいて　むれを\nつくる。　むれどうしは　なかが　わるく\nエサばを　めぐり　はげしく　あらそう。
パートナーである　トレーナーの\nぼうしを　かぶった　ちょっと\nめずらしい　ピカチュウの　すがた。
あいぼうの　トレーナーの　ぼうしを\nかぶった　ピカチュウ。　サイズが\nあっておらず　すこし　ブカブカだ。
パートナーである　トレーナーの\nぼうしを　かぶった　ちょっと\nめずらしい　ピカチュウの　すがた。
あいぼうの　トレーナーの　ぼうしを\nかぶった　ピカチュウ。　サイズが\nあっておらず　すこし　ブカブカだ。
アローラちほう　でのみ　このすがたに\nしんかする。　そのよういんの　ひとつが\nエサであると　けんきゅうかは　かたる。
ねんりきで　でんきを　あやつる。\nしっぽに　のると　サイコパワーで\nうきあがり　そのまま　いどう。
サイコパワーを　しゅうちゅう　させた\nシッポにのり　すべるように　いどう。\nおかサーファーの　いみょうを　もつ。
ほっぺを　もみしだくと　あまくて\nかぐわしい　においが　ただよう。\nただし　かるく　しびれてしまうぞ。
ゆきやまに　すむ。　はがねのこうらは\nとても　がんじょうだが　かたすぎて\nからだを　まるめることが　できない。
こおりの　うえで　サンドを　すべらせ\nそのきょりを　きそう。　こらいから\nつづく　アローラのまつりの　ひとつ。
かざんの　ふんか　から　にげるうちに\nゆきやまに　うつりすんだ。　こおりの\nこうらは　はがねなみの　かたさ。
せなかの　ひふは　はがねの　かたさ。\nやわらかい　おなかを　ねらわれるので\nひっしに　じめんに　しがみつく。
かざんふんか　から　のがれるうちに\nゆきやまに　すみつくように　なった。\nゆきしぶきをあげ　せつげんを　かける。
はがねのハリを　こおりが　おおう。\nささると　ふかい　きずと　いっしょに\nとうしょうにも　なってしまうぞ。
せつげんを　こうそくで　かける。\nゆきを　かきわけるために　ツメが\nぶっとく　するどく　はったつした。
おおむかしは　さばくに　すんでいた。\nするどいツメを　しっかり　つきたてて\nひょうざんも　すべらず　のぼっていく。
マイナス５０どの　れいきを　はく。\nアローラのろうじんは　ケオケオという\nむかしの　なまえで　よぶことも。
あついときには　６ぽんの　しっぽで\nこおりのつぶてを　つくり　あたりに\nばらまいて　からだを　ひやす。
かわいいからと　むやみに　ちかづくと\nむれの　ボスで　ある　キュウコンが\nあらわれて　こおりづけに　される。
むれで　たすけあって　いきている。\nマイナス　５０どの　いきで　えものを\nしっかり　こおらせてから　くらう。
たいもうから　こおりのつぶを　うみ\nてきに　あびせかける。　おこらせると\nいっしゅんで　こおりづけに　される。
おだやかな　きしつ。　キュウコンの\nリージョンフォームと　わかるまでは\nかみのけしんと　うやまわれていた。
ゆきやまで　まよった　にんげんを\nふもとまで　あんない　してくれるのは\nさっさと　おいはらいたいからだ。
キュウコンの　すむ　やまには　かみが\nおとずれると　いわれ　むかしは\nたちいることを　きんじられていた。
あたまから　はえているのは　ヒゲが\nへんか　したもので　きんぞくしつ。\nゆらゆら　うごき　なかまと　こうしん。
きんいろの　ヒゲは　センサーきのうを\nもっている。　あなから　だして\nまわりの　ようすを　うかがっている。
ようがんしつの　じめんも　グングン\nほりすすむほど　パワフルだが\nなかなか　すがたを　みせないぞ。
ほかの　ちほうの　ディグダよりも\nちからもち。　ようがんしつの　じめんを\nほりすすめる　うち　きたえられたのだ。
きんいろに　かがやく　ヒゲで　みを\nまもっている。　ぬけおちた　ヒゲを\nもちかえると　ふこうに　なると　いう。
だいちの　めがみたちの　けしんと\nかんがえられ　アローラちほうでは\nとても　たいせつに　されている。
きんぞくしつの　ヒゲは　おもいので\nすばやさは　いまいちだが　かたい\nがんばんも　ほりぬくパワーを　もつ。
きんいろに　ひかる　ヒゲは　こうどな\nセンサー。　すうキロさきの　おとも\nしんどうとして　かんち　できるのだ。
もともと　アローラには　いなかったが\nひとの　てで　ふえたのち　やせいか。\nズルがしこくて　プライドが　たかい。
たかいプライドを　きずつけられたり\nひたいの　こばんを　よごされると\nくるったような　ヒステリーを　おこす。
きまぐれで　わがままで　あきっぽい。\nつくされるより　つくすのが　すきな\nいちぶの　トレーナーに　だいにんき。
おおむかしに　さかえた　おうぞくが\nほかの　ちほうから　つれてきた。\nわがままで　プライドが　たかい。
まるい　かおと　さいこうきゅうの\nベルベットより　なめらかな　けなみで\nアローラで　だいにんきの　ポケモン。
じぶんいがいの　すべてを　みくだす。\nふいうちや　やみうちなど　ひれつで\nひきょうな　せんぽうを　このむ。
あいらしい　かおに　にあわず\nよわった　えものを　しとめないで\nいたぶる　ざんにんな　せいしつ。
まるいかおは　とみの　しょうちょう。\nより　ふくよかで　おおきな　かおの\nペルシアンが　うつくしいと　される。
じりょくを　おびた　いしの　からだ。\nとくに　じりょくが　つよい　ぶぶんには\nさてつが　ビッシリ　ついてるよ。
じめんで　ねている　イシツブテを\nふむと　バチンと　おとが　して\nビリッと　ぜんしんが　しびれる。
いしころと　まちがえ　ふんでしまうと\nおこって　ずつきを　かましてくる。\nいたいだけでなく　ビリッと　くるぞ。
ずつきで　なかまと　きそいあう。\nあたまの　さてつは　じりょくの\nつよいほうに　ひっついて　しまうぞ。
ドラバイトを　このんで　くらう。\nくった　せいぶんが　けっしょうになり\nからだのいちぶに　うきだしているぞ。
エサの　いしを　もとめて　ケンカ。\nゴローンどうしが　ぶつかるたびに\nばくおんと　ひかりが　ほとばしる。
ゴローンどうし　あらそうと　あたりに\nひかりと　ばくおんがする。　じもとの\nひとは　おかはなびと　よんでいる。
こうぶつの　いしの　えいきょうで\nぜんしんが　でんきを　おびている。\nとても　けんかっぱやい　せいかく。
でんきをおびた　がんせきを　はっしゃ。\nめいちゅう　せずとも　かするだけで\nあいては　しびれ　しっしんする。
がんせきは　れんしゃが　できないので\nそのあたりの　イシツブテを　つかまえ\nせなかに　こめ　はっしゃ　することも。
きむずかしくて　がんこ。　きげんを\nそこねると　ぜんしんから　ほうでんし\nらいめいの　ような　こえで　ほえる。
たいでんした　おおいわを　はっしゃ。\nちゃくだんすると　あたり　いったいに\nすさまじい　でんげきが　ほとばしる。
ゴミもんだいを　かいけつ　するため\nよそから　もちこんだ　ベトベターが\nいつのまにか　このすがたに　なった。
けっしょうは　どくその　かたまり。\nベトベターの　からだから　おちると\nしにいたる　どくそが　もれだすぞ。
アローラの　ゴミしょぶんじょう　には\n１００ぴきぜんごが　すんでいる。　みな\nたくさん　ゴミを　くう　はたらきもの。
ゴミもんだいを　かいけつ　するために\nアローラに　つれて　こられた。　どんな\nゴミでも　うまそうに　たいらげる。
やたら　あざやかな　からだの　いろは\nくらった　ゴミが　たいないで　つねに\nかがくへんかを　おこしているから。
いがいに　おとなしく　なつくが\nエサの　ゴミを　ずっと　あげていないと\nいえの　かぐを　こわして　くらいだす。
たいないに　ある　どくの　しゅるいは\n１００　いじょう。　どくと　どくの\nかがくはんのうが　いのちの　みなもと。
キバや　ツメに　みえるのは　どくその\nけっしょう。　ふれるだけで　どくに\nおかされるので　ちかづくのは　キケン。
アローラは　さいこうの　かんきょう。\nこのすがたが　ほんらいの　ナッシーだと\nじもとの　ひとびとは　ほこらしげだ。
のびのび　そだって　サイコパワーは\nいらなくなり　ねむれる　ドラゴンの\nちからが　かくせい　したのだ。
ナッシーは　アローラじんの　ほこり。\nれきしてきな　かいがや　たてものに\nその　すがたが　きざまれている。
ながいくびを　ムチのように　しならせ\nあたまを　あいてに　たたきつける。\nじぶんも　すこしクラクラしてしまう。
てにした　ホネは　ははのホネ。\nししてなお　こをおもう　ははのむねんは\nほのおとなって　ガラガラを　まもる。
なかまを　とむらう　しゅうせい。\nみちの　すみに　もりあがった　つちが\nあったら　それは　ガラガラの　はか。
みどり　ゆたかな　アローラちほうは\nガラガラに　とって　かこくな　とち。\nいきのびるため　ほのおを　あやつる。
ホネで　なぐると　のろいの　ほのおが\nもえうつる。　いくら　みずを　かけても\nいつまでも　きえずに　もえつづけるぞ。
するどい　キバで　てきを　しとめる。\nずっと　このからだを　いじ　できず\nいっていじかんで　バラバラになる。
セルと　よばれる　ジガルデの　いちぶが\n１０％ほど　あつまった　すがた。\nじそく１００キロで　ちを　かける。
ジガルデの　いちぶが　１わりほど\nあつまった。　あいての　ふところに\nとびかかり　するどいキバで　かみつく。
かくちの　ジガルデ・セルが\n１０％　あつまったとき　うまれる。\nせっきんせんが　とくいだぞ。
するどい　キバで　てきを　しとめる。\nずっと　このからだを　いじ　できず\nいっていじかんで　バラバラになる。
セルと　よばれる　ジガルデの　いちぶが\n１０％ほど　あつまった　すがた。\nじそく１００キロで　ちを　かける。
ジガルデの　いちぶが　１わりほど\nあつまった。　あいての　ふところに\nとびかかり　するどいキバで　かみつく。
かくちの　ジガルデ・セルが\n１０％　あつまったとき　うまれる。\nせっきんせんが　とくいだぞ。
セルが　５０％　あつまった　すがた。\nてきたい　するものは　いっさいの\nてかげんなく　しょうめつ　させる。
せいたいけいを　かんし　していると\nかんがえられている。　さらなる\nちからを　ひめているとの　ウワサ。
ジガルデの　いちぶが　はんぶんほど\nあつまった　すがた。　せいたいけいを\nかんしする　やくめを　もっている。
せいたいけいを　おびやかす　ものと\nたたかうとき　さらに　きょうりょくな\nすがたに　へんかすると　いわれる。
せいたいけいを　おびやかすものを\nあっとうてきな　ちからを　もって\nせいあつする　ジガルデの　すがた。
１００％の　ジガルデの　すがた。\nゼルネアスや　イベルタルをも\nあっとうする　ちからを　もつ。
かんぺきなる　ジガルデの　すがた。\nむねの　くちから　すべてを　けしさる\nこうエネルギーを　ほうしゃする。
すべての　ジガルデ・セルが　あつまり\nたんじょうする。　せいたいけいを\nみだすものを　ぶりょくで　しずめる。
やまぶきのミツを　すった　オドリドリ。\nあかるく　ようきな　ダンスは　てきの\nみも　こころも　はじけさせる。
うもうを　こすりあわせ　たいでん。\nおどるように　てきに　ちかづき\nでんげきパンチを　おみまいするぞ。
ようきな　ダンスで　てきの　こころを\nもりあげて　ゆだんした　ところに\nでんげきを　あびせ　かんでんさせる。
やまぶきのミツを　すった　オドリドリ。\nげんきの　ない　ひとを　みかけると\nダンスで　はげまそうと　してくれるよ。
ゆらゆら　ゆれて　リラックス。\nこうして　たかまった　サイコパワーを\nてきに　めがけて　ほうしゃするぞ。
うすもものミツを　すった　オドリドリ。\nおだやかに　こしをふり　てきの\nみも　こころも　とろけさせる。
ゆうがな　ダンスで　てきの　こころを\nリラックスさせ　ゆだんした　ところに\nサイコパワーを　あびせかける。
うすもものミツを　すった　オドリドリ。\nおどっている　ときは　トレーナーの\nしじが　きこえないほど　マイペース。
むらさきのミツを　すった　オドリドリ。\nみやびで　あでやかな　まいは　てきの\nみも　こころも　いかいへ　いざなう。
げんそうてきな　まいで　ししゃを\nよびよせる。　そのおんねんの　ちからを\nかりて　てきに　のろいを　かけるぞ。
みやびな　ダンスで　てきの　こころを\nみりょうして　ゆだんした　ところに\nしをまねく　のろいを　あびせかける。
むらさきのミツを　すった　オドリドリ。\nしなやかで　あでやかな　おどりを\nさんこうにする　ダンサーも　いる。
てごわい　あいてを　まえに　するほど\nちが　たかぶる。　かつためなら\nわがみを　かえりみず　おそいかかる。
てきを　ちょうはつし　おそわせる。\nにくを　きらせて　ずつきを　くらわせ\nタテガミの　いわで　ほねを　くだく。
きにいらない　めいれいは　へいきで\nむし。　あいてを　しとめるためなら\nきずつくことも　まるで　きにしない。
むれを　つくらず　１ぴきで　くらす。\nじぶんの　ちからを　ひきだしてくれる\nトレーナーの　いうことしか　きかない。
よわい　ヨワシたちが　むれて　ちからを\nけっしゅう。　うみの　まものと\nおそれられるほどの　ちからを　もつ。
そのすがたに　ギャラドスも　にげだす。\nちからを　あわせ　うつ　みずでっぽうは\nハイドロポンプを　しのぐ　いりょく。
ヨワシたちが　てきに　たちむかうため\nじんけいを　くんだ。　うみのまものと\nよばれるほどの　ちからを　ほこる。
うみの　まものと　よばれて　いる。\nたたかいで　きずつき　ヨワシのかずが\nへると　ただの　むれに　もどる。
せいぎょマスクを　みずから　はかい。\nとくしゅメモリを　そうび　することで\nタイプを　かえられるように　なった。
かくせいし　ＡＲシステムが　はつどう。\nとくしゅな　メモリに　たいおうして\nタイプチェンジし　てきに　たちむかう。
かくせいに　せいこう。　でんせつの\nポケモンの　ように　じぶんのタイプを\nへんかさせ　たたかうことが　できる。
ふういん　された　タイプチェンジの\nのうりょくを　かいほう。　わきあがる\nエネルギーで　ぎんいろに　かがやく。

かくせいし　ＡＲシステムが　はつどう。\nとくしゅな　メモリに　たいおうして\nタイプチェンジし　てきに　たちむかう。
かくせいに　せいこう。　でんせつの\nポケモンの　ように　じぶんのタイプを\nへんかさせ　たたかうことが　できる。
ふういん　された　タイプチェンジの\nのうりょくを　かいほう。　わきあがる\nエネルギーで　ぎんいろに　かがやく。
たいきちゅうの　チリを　くっている。\nくった　チリの　せいぶんに　よって\nコアの　いろあいが　きまる。
コアが　むきだしの　ままだと　じきに\nしょうめつ。　いそいで　ボールに\nいれれば　いきながらえると　いう。
よぞらから　ふってくる　メテノと\nであえる　スポットは　かぎられていて\nアローラは　きちょうな　そのひとつ。
がいかくの　むけた　すがた。\nコアの　いろの　ちがいは　たべた\nエサの　せいぶんに　よるもの。
ゆうひを　あび　とくべつな　しんかを\nした　ルガルガン。　ものしずかだが\nはげしい　とうしを　ひめている。
たそがれどきに　しんかした　けっか\nなぜか　かわった　すがたに。\nアローラでは　とても　めずらしい。
ソルガレオのひかりを　くらいつづける\nすがた。　てきに　とびかかり　せなかと\nししのツメで　あいてを　きりさく。
ソルガレオの　パワーを　すいつづける\nネクロズマの　すがた。　ひじょうに\nきょうぼうで　てが　つけられない。
ルナアーラに　もはや　いしは　ない。\nネクロズマに　しはいされ　すべての\nエネルギーを　ほうしゅつ　しつづける。
ルナアーラのひかりを　くらいつづける\nすがた。　きょだいな　ツメで　てきを\nつかむと　ちからまかせに　ひきちぎる。
あっとうてきな　ひかりエネルギーを\nきゅうしゅうし　へんかした　すがた。\nぜんしんから　レーザーこうを　はなつ。
ぜんしんから　はなたれる　ひかりは\nせいぶつや　しぜんに　さようし\nさまざまな　えいきょうを　およぼす。
かいちゅうの　プランクトンを　くう。\nきれいな　うみに　すむ　カラナクシほど\nあざやかな　たいしょくを　している。
カラナクシの　いろの　ちがいは\nエサに　よるもの。　のうりょくに\nおおきな　へんかは　みられない。
キケンを　かんじると　むらさきいろの\nしるを　ふきだす。　きんちょうによる\nあぶらあせ　という　せつが　ある。
たかい　さいせいのうりょくに　めを\nつけた　かがくしゃが　さいぼうの\nせいぶんを　ぶんせきちゅう。
まだ　みぬ　いろの　トリトドンを\nみつけるために　けんきゅうチームが\nせかいの　うみを　ちょうさちゅう。
うまれた　うみとは　ちがう　ばしょで\nトリトドンを　そだてると　どうなるか\nじっけんが　おこなわれている。
おそわれると　むらさきいろの　しるを\nふきだす。　どくでは　ないが　にくが\nにがくなるので　くわれないのだ。
ぶんるいじょうは　シェルダーや\nパルシェンの　しんせき。　うみから\nあがって　エサを　さがすことも　ある。
はなの　ちからが　ないと　キケン。\nでも　すきな　いろと　かたちが\nみつかるまで　たびを　つづけるぞ。
あたまの　かんむりは　はなの\nかふんを　あつめて　つくったもの。\nいやしの　こうかが　ひめられている。

When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by\nreleasing a terrifically strong odor from its\nantennae, but it often becomes their prey.
It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making\nit one of the top recommendations for novice\nPokémon Trainers.
Perhaps because it would like to grow up\nquickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating\na hundred leaves a day.
Its body is soft and weak. In nature, its\nperpetual fate is to be seen by others as food.
Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesn’t\nmove much because of the risk it might\ncarelessly spill its innards out.
Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell.\nIt’s been known to break, so intense battles\nwith it should be avoided.
Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the\ncells throughout its body are being rebuilt in\npreparation for evolution.
Its hard shell doesn’t crack a bit even if Pikipek\npecks at it, but it will tip over, spilling out\nits insides.
Close examination of its large eyes reveals that\neach eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.
When attacked by other Pokémon, it defends\nitself by scattering its poisonous scales and\nfluttering its wings.
Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds\nbird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree\nsprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.
Nectar from pretty flowers is its favorite food.\nIn fields of flowers, it has heated battles with\nCutiefly for territory.
Its incisors continue growing until its death.\nIf its Trainer doesn’t offer it a file to gnaw on, it\nwill gnaw on door frames, table legs, and so on.
With their strong capacity for survival, they can\nlive in dirty places without concern. Left\nunchecked, their numbers multiply rapidly.
Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life.\nIf its incisors get too long, this Pokémon\nbecomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.
This Pokémon is common but hazardous. Its\nsharp incisors can easily cut right through\nhard wood.
Its hind feet are webbed, so it’s a strong\nswimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes\neven oceans.
Its disposition is far more violent than its looks\nwould suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close\nto its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.
People say that it fled from its enemies by\nusing its small webbed hind feet to swim\nfrom island to island in Alola.
Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its\nbalance. No matter how friendly you are, it will\nget angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.
Its short wings make it inept at flying.\nIt moves about hurriedly and pecks at\nBug-type Pokémon in the tall grass.
Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug\nPokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous\nappetite and look after it.
Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to\nothers—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect\nits territory.
Due to its short wings, it can’t fly long\ndistances. It wanders about restlessly and\npecks at bug Pokémon.
It’s tough and has excellent stamina.\nIt has no problem flying continuously\nfor a whole day carrying a heavy load.
Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can\nbe seen in murals from deep in ancient history.
Carrying food through Fearow’s territory is\ndangerous. It will snatch the food away from\nyou in a flash!
In Alola, fish Pokémon are its prey. It can be\nseen circling above the ocean searching\nfor food.
By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger\nthan itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.
The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food.\nIt swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg\ngets stuck, and Ekans faints.
The latest research has determined that there\nare over 20 possible arrangements of the\npatterns on its stomach.
After stunning its opponents with the pattern\non its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its\nbody and waits for them to stop moving.
A plan was recently announced to gather\nmany Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
It’s in its nature to store electricity. It feels\nstressed now and then if it’s unable to fully\ndischarge the electricity.
Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests\nwhere nests of Pikachu live are dangerous,\nsince the trees are so often struck by lightning.
While sleeping, it generates electricity in the\nsacs in its cheeks. If it’s not getting enough\nsleep, it will be able to use only weak electricity.
It unleashes electric shocks that can reach\n100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out\neven an Indian elephant.
It becomes aggressive when it has electricity\nstored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to\ntake care to avoid being attacked.
As electricity builds up inside its body, it\nbecomes more aggressive. One theory is that\nthe electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
Because so many Trainers like the way Pikachu\nlooks, you don’t see this Pokémon very often.
It can roll its body into a ball. It moves through\nthe desert by rolling at high speeds.
It usually makes its home in deserts and arid\nzones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to\ncatch Bug-type Pokémon.
It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger\napproaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its\nsoft stomach.
When its skin gets wrinkled from moisture, it\nheads for a volcano. It lies flat on a spot with a\nlot of geothermal heat and dries itself out.
Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes\noften break off. They grow back the next day,\nso it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls\nits body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto\nany prey that appears.
Its claws and horns often break off. The broken\nclaws and horns can be used to carve plows for\ntilling farm fields.
Thanks to its thick claws, it’s good at climbing\ntrees. There are plenty of Sandslash that park\nthemselves in trees and go right to sleep.
Its adorable behavior and appearance make it\npopular with men and women, young and old.\nIts numbers are few, however.
On nights with a full moon, they gather together\nand dance. The surrounding area is enveloped\nin an abnormal magnetic field.
They’re popular, but they’re rare. Trainers who\nshow them off recklessly may be targeted\nby thieves.
Bathed in moonlight, its wings glow faintly.\nWithout even flapping, Clefairy rises into the air,\nwhere it dances around.
They don’t like to reveal themselves in front of\npeople. They live quietly in packs deep in\nthe mountains.
According to tradition, people who see a pair\nof Clefable skipping by can look forward to a\nhappy marriage.
It can’t help but hear a pin drop from over half\na mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains\nwhere there aren’t many people or Pokémon.
Some scientists believe that it gazes intently at\nthe sky on nights with a full moon because\nit’s homesick.
Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very\npopular. As it grows, its tails split to form\nmore tails.
From its mouth spew flames that seem to\nresemble the spirits of the deceased. Some\npeople mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
Its beautiful tails have made it very popular.\nHowever, if it’s not brushed diligently, it will\nbe a mass of tangles before you know it.
It manipulates balls of fire to catch its prey.\nIf you raise one from when it’s young, it will\ngrow close to you like a puppy Pokémon.
Legend has it that this mystical Pokémon was\nformed when nine saints coalesced into one.
Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon\nuses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire.\nIt can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.
It is vindictive and relentless by nature.\nThose who cross it even once will be cursed for\na thousand years, along with their descendants.
The flickering flames it spews from its mouth\nleave its opponents hypnotized. Then, this\nextremely intelligent Pokémon attacks.
It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a\nmysterious melody. If you hear this melody,\nyou’ll become sleepy right away.
Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds\n12 octaves, but each individual’s singing skill\ndepends on its own effort.
Recordings of Jigglypuff’s strange lullabies can\nbe purchased from department stores. These\nCDs can be found near the bedding area.
The songs they sing are totally different\ndepending on the region they live in. Some even\nsound like they’re shouting!
It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change.\nThe fur is gathered and spun into a\nluxurious yarn.
As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and\nexpands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one\ncan inflate itself the most.
Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur,\nthis Pokémon is sought after. Holding one\nin your arms while you sleep feels great.
When it gets angry, it inhales with all its might,\nand its body gradually inflates. Sometimes they\ncan grow 20 times larger!
It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes,\nso to check its surroundings while flying, it\nemits ultrasonic waves.
When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns.\nThe frequency of their ultrasonic waves can\ndiffer slightly from colony to colony.
It has no eyeballs, so it can’t see. It checks its\nsurroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits\nfrom its mouth.
Their skin is so thin that they’ll be burned if\nsunlight hits them. When it gets cold out, they\ngather together to warm one another’s bodies.
Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making\nthem unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are\nspecialized for sucking blood.
Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t\nfly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and\nbecome food for other Pokémon.
Every once in a while, you’ll see a Golbat that’s\nmissing some fangs. This happens when hunger\ndrives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.
They can suck down over 10 ounces of blood in\none go. They have been known to drink so much\nblood that they can no longer fly.
No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms\ngrowing on its back steal away most of\nthe nutrients it consumes.
Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its\nback. They can be dried and powdered to make\na medicine used to extend life.
Whether it’s due to a lack of moisture or a lack\nof nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras\ndon’t grow up quite right.
The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are\ncontrolling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the\nmushrooms, they tell it to bug off.
The large mushroom on its back controls it.\nIt often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap.\nOnce harvested, these spores can be steeped\nand boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on\nits back having become the main body. If the\nmushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.
Its poisonous spores are also used in traditional\nmedicine. Apparently, spores produced in Alola\nare not of very good quality.
It chews on plant roots underground.\nFarmers whose vegetables are vulnerable\nfind it can be quite a pest.
Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett\nbecause its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.
It travels through tunnels that it digs\nunderground. It hates sunlight, so it comes\nout only after the sun goes down.
Around their crops, farmers plant the kind of\ntree that Diglett like to eat as a way of getting\nDiglett to plow the fields for them.
This set of triplets moves cooperatively.\nIt’s the power of teamwork that enables\nthis Pokémon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
Despite the closeness between this Pokémon\nand farmers and other people, no one has ever\nseen the parts of it concealed underground.
While the three of them normally get along\nsplendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will\nbreak out over which head gets to eat first.
Dugtrio’s heads are sleek and smooth and\nincredibly hard. It can dig through any soil with\nits headbutts.
It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk.\nAt night, it wanders the city in search of\nloose change.
It loves shiny things. It often fights with\nMurkrow over prey they’re both trying to catch.
When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight\nof it having an intense fight with Murkrow over\nshiny objects.
It loves coins, so if you give it one, you can\nmake friends with Meowth easily. But it’s fickle,\nso you can’t count on that friendship lasting.
It has a violent temperament. It will attack\nanything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp\nclaws inflict deep wounds.
It has a high opinion of itself, although not to\nthe same extent as the Alolan Persian. It’s quite\ndifficult to make friends with this Pokémon.
Although the jewel on its forehead appears to\nbe a different color than those of Alolan\nPersian, it’s mostly made of the same material.
This Pokémon is popular with rich people.\nIt’s also targeted by hunters who are after\nthe jewel in its forehead.
As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it\nto cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without\nmeaning to.
This Pokémon is troubled by constant\nheadaches. The more pain it’s in, the more\npowerful its psychokinesis becomes.
Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it\nnormally passes the time spacing out and doing\nas little as possible.
It has been found that its brain cells are\n10 times more active when Psyduck is\nexperiencing a headache.
It is said that the red part of its forehead\ngrants supernatural powers to those who\npossess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
It swims along the banks of lakes and catches\nfish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and\nquietly eats them up.
Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be\ndisabled by Golduck. It brings them to a\nstandstill and seizes them.
A professional swimmer, it can continue\nswimming for two days straight by waving its\nlong tail skillfully.
It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone\nnear it clears out as it rampages, and the\nresulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep,\nbut the anger resonating in its dreams causes it\nto wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
The smallest of things could cause it to lose its\ntemper. Because it doesn’t hold in its stress,\nthis Pokémon can live a long time.
If one gets angry, all the others around it will\nget angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop\nof Mankey.
It has been known to become so angry that\nit dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in\ndeath, however.
Some researchers theorize that Primeape\nremains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
It will never forgive opponents who have\nangered it. Even after it has beaten them down\nuntil they can’t move, it never ever forgives.
The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than\nthose of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy\ndespite its constant raging.
It’s both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries\nto invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
It looks cute, but when you approach another\nTrainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.
While it’s quite friendly toward humans once it’s\ngrown used to them, in the wild it must be quite\nfierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.
It has lived alongside humans since ages ago.\nIts bones have been found in excavations of\nruins from the Stone Age.
Overflowing with beauty and majesty,\nthis strong Pokémon appears in ancient\nEastern folklore.
The fire burning inside its body serves as the\nenergy to fuel it as it runs great distances.\nIt appears in many legends.
Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general\nand conquering a whole country.
There are so many old tales about them that\nthey’re called legendary Pokémon, but there are\nway more of them around than you’d expect.
The swirl on its belly is its internal organs\nshowing through. If the swirl is tinged white,\nthat means it’s affected by some disease.
It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers\nshould train this Pokémon to walk every day.
Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land.\nSo it does its best to waddle along, but when\nan enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.
The direction of the swirl on their stomachs\ndiffers depending on where they live. Poliwag\naficionados can tell them apart at a glance.
Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in\nthe water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
It marches over the land in search of bug\nPokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater\nso it can dine on them where it’s safe.
Although it has become capable of living on\nland, it spends its time in the water, where\nits prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.
Its health suffers when its skin dries out, so be\nsure to moisturize it diligently.
Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong\nswimmers that use the breaststroke. Many\nchildren learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its\nbody is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy\nand forces its swimming prowess to develop.
It’s quite a gifted swimmer, even among\nWater-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its\ntime on land.
The muscles it has developed through swimming\nare thick and powerful. When it lands a square\npunch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping,\nit will teleport itself to treetops and pick and\neat berries there.
It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep,\nbut when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is,\nso it panics.
It uses various psychic powers even while it’s\nsleeping, so you can’t tell whether or not\nit’s awake.
It can read others’ minds and will teleport away\nwhen danger approaches. You must clear your\nmind if you want to catch it.
A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young\nboy who couldn’t control his psychic powers\nand ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
Kadabra’s presence infests televisions and\nmonitors with creepy shadows that bring\nbad luck.
It stares at a silver spoon to amplify its psychic\npowers before it lets loose. Apparently, gold\nspoons are no good.
It possesses strong mental capabilities, but its\npsychic powers are halved when it’s not\nholding a silver spoon.
It is said to have an IQ of approximately 5,000.\nIts overflowing psychokinetic powers\ncause headaches to anyone nearby.
Its brain cells continue to increase in number\nuntil its death. The older the Alakazam, the\nlarger its head.
Alakazam uses its psychic powers to make the\nspoons it carries. Each spoon is an original that\nthere’s only one of in the whole world.
If it trusts someone deeply, it will let them have\none of its spoons. Anything you eat with that\nspoon is apparently delicious.
It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles,\nwhich continue to swell day by day, it becomes\nmore and more dedicated to its training.
With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw\na hundred people all at the same time. Its\nstrength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
Once this Pokémon has gained enough\nconfidence and muscle from training with its\nfriends, it challenges Makuhita to a battle.
It likes food that’s highly nutritious because its\ninstincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.
As a result of its continual workouts, it has\ndeveloped tremendous power. It uses that\npower to help people with their work.
It willingly assists with hard labor because it\nknows the work is good training for its muscles.
When it encounters an enemy that’s truly\nmighty, this Pokémon removes the power-save\nbelt from its waist and unleashes its full power.
A popular motif for sculptures, its incredibly\nwell-developed muscles have captured the\nimagination of many an artist.
It unleashes megaton-level punches that send\nopponents flying clear over the horizon.
It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease.\nIt can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy\nfingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
It grasps its opponents with its four arms and\ntwists them up in an intricate hold. People call\nit “the Machamp special.”
With four arms, it can attack and defend\nsimultaneously. It’s said to have mastered\nevery martial art in the world.
They can be found lying dehydrated on\nbeaches, but they are often still alive.\nWhen soaked in water, they will revive.
It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near\nbeaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its\ntoxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.
It drifts through the sea searching for prey.\nIts poisonous tentacles break off sometimes,\nbut after a while, they grow back.
Its body is 99% water. The remaining 1%\ncontains the organ that makes its poison.
Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles.\nThe longer one has been alive, the fewer\ntentacles it will have.
Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large\noutbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon\ndisappear from the surrounding sea.
It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs\nto weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up\nin its 80 tentacles.
It communicates with others of its kind by\nlighting up the red orbs on its head. When\nthe orbs are blinking, it’s a warning sign.
Its round body makes it easy to pick up,\nbut it is hard and heavy. It’s dangerous\nto play with them as if they were snowballs.
There are plenty of them to be found along any\nroad. A scholar with too much free time once\ncounted a hundred of them along a single route.
Geodude that have lived a long life have had all\ntheir edges smoothed out until they’re totally\nround. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.
It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs.\nPeople who see it in action have been known to\ntake up bouldering.
Mossy rocks are its favorite food.\nIt can devour a ton a day while crunching loudly.
This slow-footed Pokémon moves by curling up\nand rolling instead of walking. With enough\nmomentum, its speed can exceed 60 mph.
It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak\nof a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit,\nit rolls back down the way it came.
It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a\nriver, it will explode with its last gasp.
Its body can survive dynamite blasts without\na single scratch, but it hates rain and humidity.
Once a year, this Pokémon molts, and its shed\nshell returns to the soil. This process creates\nenriched soil, so farmers collect the shells.
When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their\nshells. Those that have lived a long, long time\nhave shells green with moss.
It detonates its own body. The power from\nthat explosion can propel it up steep mountain\npaths with amazing speed.
Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn’t really\nfeel any pain, though, and the tail grows back,\nso Slowpoke isn’t particularly bothered.
Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke\ntails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
There are some places where Slowpoke is\nworshiped because of a long-standing belief\nthat whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.
Although their tails, which fall off naturally, can\neasily be found lying around, they’re a precious\ningredient for cooking.
It spaces out while gazing at the sea.\nWith Shellder’s poison flowing through its body,\nit becomes even spacier.
Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail,\nit gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it\nforgets a moment later.
Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back\ninto Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder,\nbreaks off.
Shellder, in its greed to suck out more and more\nsweetness from Slowbro’s tail, has\nmetamorphosed into a spiral-shaped shell.
They gather in places where electricity is\navailable. They can be found clinging to the\nsteel towers used to support power lines.
It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it\nfloat through the air. Touching it while it’s eating\nelectricity will give you a full-body shock.
It’s frequently the cause of power outages,\nwhich is why some power plants send out\nelectrical signals that it can’t stand.
Perhaps because electrical lines are often\nburied these days, the number of Magnemite\nattacks on power plants has increased.
When three Magnemite link together, their brains\nalso become one. They do not become three\ntimes more intelligent.
It has about three times the electrical power of\nMagnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this\nPokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas\ninhabited by Magneton, which send out\nmysterious electrical signals.
When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather\nin high places to wait for lightning to strike.
It has always been supposed that Seel live only\nin cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is\na mystery.
Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don’t bother it\nat all, but it gets tired pretty easily in\nwarm waters.
It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight\nknots, searching for Pokémon that will become\nits prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.
It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise\nin its body temperature helps its digestion.
Its main source of food is the slimy industrial\nwaste of factories. This Pokémon’s numbers\nhave been decreasing in recent years.
It was born from sludge transformed by\nexposure to X-rays from the moon. When its\ninternal load of germs decreases, it dies.
It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a\nsterile environment, the germs within its body\ncan’t multiply, and it dies.
The wastewater coming from factories is clean\nthese days, so Grimer have nothing to eat.\nThey’re said to be on the verge of extinction.
The stench it gives off will make your nose\nscrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think\nthat’s a good thing.
After recent environmental improvements, this\nPokémon is now hardly seen at all. People\nspeculate that it may go extinct at some point.
Their food sources have decreased, and their\nnumbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds\nare being built to prevent their extinction.
Because they scatter germs everywhere,\nthey’ve long been targeted for extermination,\nleading to a steep decline in their population.
The hardness of its shell surpasses the\nhardness of a diamond. In days gone by,\npeople used the shells to make shields.
This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out.\nIt uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up\nsand from the seabed in its search for food.
The sand that accumulates inside its shell\neventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets\nin the way, so it spits it out and discards it.
Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still\nhangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank,\nthe shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.
Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even\nby a bomb. The contents of the shell\nremain unknown.
Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting\ntribes has turned up many spears tipped with\nspikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.
If areas of Cloyster’s very hard shell get\ndamaged, those areas swell, gradually growing\ninto large sharp spikes.
Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even\nbeen known to come up on land to look for\nSlowpoke from time to time.
Should a strange light be seen flickering\nin an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
Although Gastly is barely visible, when it’s near,\na faint sweet smell lingers.
It’s said that gas emanating from a graveyard\nwas possessed by the grievances of the\ndeceased and thus became a Pokémon.
Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It’s\nsaid that the remaining 5% is made up of the\nsouls of those who died from the gas.
It strikes at humans from total darkness.\nThose licked by its cold tongue grow weaker\nwith each passing day until they die.
It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may\nbe on the verge of extinction in cities that stay\nbrightly lit at night.
On moonless nights, Haunter searches for\nsomeone to curse, so it’s best not to go out\nwalking around.
It’s dangerous to go outside alone on nights\nwhen you’re feeling sad. Haunter will catch you,\nand you won’t be able to go back home.
Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden\nchill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar.\nThere is no escaping it. Give up.
It apparently wishes for a traveling companion.\nSince it was once human itself, it tries to create\none by taking the lives of other humans.
You can hear tales told all over the world about\nhow Gengar will pay a visit to children who\nare naughty.
Even your home isn’t safe. Gengar will lurk in\nwhatever dark corner of a room it can find and\nwait for its chance to catch its prey.
A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating\ndreams, it is thought to share common ancestry\nwith Munna and Musharna.
It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes\nfriends with people, it may show them the most\ndelicious dreams it’s ever eaten.
It can be spotted near recreational facilities,\nintending to eat the pleasant dreams of children\nwho enjoyed themselves there that day.
It puts its prey to sleep and devours their\ndreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour,\nso Drowzee doesn’t particularly like eating them.
While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon,\npeople who are in need of a good, sound sleep\ncall it their savior.
As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets\nfall asleep and has a taste of their dreams.\nAnyone having a good dream, it carries off.
In Alola, Komala is Hypno’s main target. It rarely\nharms people.
There are some Hypno that assist doctors with\npatients who can’t sleep at night in hospitals.
Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate\namong themselves. It is believed to carry\nplant genes and the genes of other species.
Six of them together form a full-fledged\nPokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler,\nbut uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one\nof the six be lost, the next morning there will\nonce more be six.
Although they are the same size as other\nExeggcute, the ones produced in Alola are quite\nheavy. Their shells are packed full.
Each of its heads has its own will. They use\ntelepathy to discuss their plans before coming\nto a joint decision.
When the time comes, one of its three heads\nfalls off. Before long, the fallen head grows into\nan Exeggcute.
It engages its enemies using psychic powers.\nEach of its three heads fires off psychokinetic\nenergy, tripling its power.
Each of its three heads has its own thoughts.\nWhen they want to go in different directions,\nExeggutor becomes unable to move.
When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps\nloudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack\nit from the air.
The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead\nmother. According to some, it will evolve when\nit comes to terms with the pain of her death.
At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother,\nbut those cries only attract its natural\nenemy—Mandibuzz.
It wears its mother’s skull on its head, so no\none knows what its bare face looks like.\nHowever, it’s clear that it’s always crying.
Originally, it was weak and timid. After evolution,\nits temperament becomes violent, and it begins\nto wield bones as weapons.
This Pokémon is out for vengeance on its natural\nenemy, Mandibuzz. It throws bones like\nboomerangs to try to take it down.
It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down.\nIt’s thought that Marowak is trying to avenge\nits parent.
They thump their bones rhythmically to\ncommunicate among themselves. There are\nnearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.
It checks out whatever’s around it by licking\neverything. If you don’t clean off a spot where\nit’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!
It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it\nlicks always stinks afterward, so whether it’s\nreally clean is...questionable.
The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients\nand a favorite food of many Pokémon.
Not only are these Pokémon fast runners,\nthey’re also few in number, so anyone who finds\none must be lucky indeed.
It seems that other Pokémon’s efforts to take\nits delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused\nChansey to get faster at fleeing.
Because the eggs on their bellies have been\noverharvested by people in the past, the\nChansey population remains very small.
Kangaskhan’s maternal love is so deep that it\nwill brave death to protect its offspring.
The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly\nthree years. That is the only time the mother is\nheard to cry wildly.
Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in\nits pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those\nwho harm its child and will beat them down.
You shouldn’t get close to the child when it’s\nplaying outside its mother’s pouch. Its mother is\nalways nearby watching over it.
When the weather grows warm, they form\ngroups and swim upriver. This sight serves\nas a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
Spellbound by the length of its horn and the\nbeauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise\nGoldeen and nothing but Goldeen.
Although known for their splendid tail fins,\nGoldeen apparently compete among themselves\nto see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.
The way it swims along fluttering its dress-like\nfins has earned it the name “princess of\nthe water.”
When the weather grows cold, its whole body\nflushes a deep red. This sight serves as a\npoetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided\ninto horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts.\nThe two groups do not get along well.
Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out\nrocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the\nmale is more vivid.
To attract females, males dance on the river’s\nfloor. The females gather around the male that\ndances most gracefully.
Large numbers of these Pokémon make their\nhome at the seaside. At night, a strange red\nglow radiates from the center of their bodies.
This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and\nothers. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates\nfast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.
In many places, there are folktales of stardust\nfalling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.
No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its\namazing regenerative powers return it to its\nprevious state in half a day!
Its shining core is thought to receive and\ntransmit enigmatic signals. It has been known\nto cause headaches in those who approach it.
Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract\nart, led local people to spread rumors that this\nPokémon may be an invader from outer space.
Its sparkling core is called “the gem of the sea.”\nThis core can be made into high-priced\naccessories that are traded in secret.
It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim\nthrough the water. It always seems to be\nsending out mysterious radio waves.
Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may\nbecome enraptured while watching it, but next\nthing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.
It creates invisible walls with its pantomiming.\nIf you don’t act impressed, it will attack you\nwith a double slap!
It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like\nmovements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves\nthem with its scythes.
While young, they live together deep in the\nmountains, training themselves in how to fight\nwith their scythes and move at high speeds.
Its two sharp scythes are more than just\nweapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress\nits prey before eating.
Some call it a ninja. Its movements—\nimperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave\nthe air in two. It’s very popular in Alola.
It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The\nprecise movements of Jynx living in Alola are\ntruly wonderful.
Its strange cries sound like human language.\nThere are some musicians who compose songs\nfor Jynx to sing.
Half of all sudden blackouts are caused\nby Electabuzz gathering at electric power\nplants and gobbling up electricity.
Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater\nthan the amount of electricity it eats.
Electricity permeates its body. It swings\nits arms round and round to charge up\nelectricity before unleashing a punch.
While it’s often blamed for power outages, the\ntruth is the cause of outages is more often\nan error on the part of the electric company.
When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a\nvolcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its\nweariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all\nover its body. It doesn’t calm down until its\nopponent has burned to ash.
Its entire body is burning. When it breathes,\nthe temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames\nshoot out!
The hotter the place, the better they feel.\nMagmar in Alola are said to be hardier than\nthose in other areas.

Its wings and antennae don’t cope well with\nmoisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to\ndry off.
Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike\npatterns of its eyespots. If that doesn’t work, it\ndeftly makes its escape on its set of four wings.
Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent.\nIt waits out rainy days in tree hollows.
It was originally brought in from another region,\nbut now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.
Their daily routine consists of training together\nfirst thing in the morning, eating and napping in\nthe afternoon, and then more training afterward.
It practices its slaps by repeatedly slapping\ntree trunks. It has been known to slap an\nExeggutor and get flung away.
There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew\nthat Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it\ngrows older, it focuses more on\ntraining Makuhita.
They love to compare their freakish strength—\nstrength enough to send a truck flying with a\nsingle slap.
Although they enjoy comparing their strength,\nthey’re also kind. They value etiquette, praising\nopponents they battle.
Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily\nstrong. There are some small ones that move\nnimbly and use moves skillfully.
The magnet in Nosepass’s nose provides an\nunerring compass, making it an excellent\npartner for Trainers going on a journey.
It uses powerful magnetism to drag its prey\ntoward it. It’s also been known to pull in metal,\nwhich it collects and uses to protect itself.
It moves less than an inch a year, but when\nit’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the\nground in a split second.
It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in\nits prey with powerful magnetism. But\nsometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.
It’s a fiend for gemstones, so it stalks Carbink.\nUnfortunately, Gabite almost always grabs\nthem first.
This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes\nbegin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed\nthat Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.
It digs through the ground with its hard claws\nand crunches down gems with its thick pointy\nteeth. Carbink is its favorite food.
Materials from gems it has eaten float to the\nsurface of its body and can form an infinite\nnumber of patterns among individuals.
A cunning and terrifying Pokémon, its cuteness\nmakes opponents let down their guard—and\nthen it swallows them whole with its huge jaws.
It has two mouths. The big jaws on the back of\nits head can’t taste anything, so that’s the\nmouth it uses to eat foods it doesn’t like.
Friction between the air and its fur produces\nstatic electricity. When Electrike runs, it makes\na crackling sound.
Static electricity builds up all over its body\nas strands of its long fur rub together. This\nPokémon boasts incredible speed.
Manectric can be found beneath unnatural\nthunderclouds. People say it can run at the\nsame speed as lightning striking.
It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so\nit can move quickly. It eases its soreness with\nelectricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.
Each school has its own territory. Any intruders\nare mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.
If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they\nrush to attack en masse. When alone, they’re\nrather cowardly.
They’re such cowards that they won’t hunt\nalone. When five or so of them get together,\nthey suddenly turn ferocious!
With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily\nchomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with\nBasculin over food.
It pursues its prey at speeds of 75 mph and\nfinishes them off with fangs that can crush iron.\nIt is known as the bully of the sea.
It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin\nwas a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokémon\nbecame a victim of overfishing.
People believe that carrying one of its\ndiscarded fangs will prevent mishaps at sea,\nso the fangs are made into accessories.
It drinks in seawater and jets it from its rear to\npropel itself. It’s very sensitive to the scent\nof blood.
It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with\nseawater and plays by bouncing around like\na ball.
It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from\nthe nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of\nWishiwashi every day.
It swims along with its mouth open and\nswallows down seawater along with its food.\nIt sprays excess water out of its nostrils.
Due to their memories of when they once lived\non land, pods of them will, very rarely, wash up\non shore.
Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their\nlarge mouths, they can swallow entire schools\nof Wishiwashi whole.
Its immense size is the reason for its popularity.\nWailord watching is a favorite sightseeing\nactivity in various parts of the world.
They eat so many fish Pokémon that when\nWailord become too numerous, fishermen have\nto chase them off.
When a small Wailmer is attacked by Sharpedo\nor Dhelmise, its whole pod works together to\nprotect it.
Coal is the source of Torkoal’s energy. Large\namounts of coal can be found in the mountains\nwhere they live.
If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will\ndie. Those who wish to raise one in their home\nmust always keep something flammable at hand.
You can tell how it’s feeling by the smoke\nspouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity\nis a sign of good health.
It burns coal to produce energy. When it has\nburned through all of its coal, it becomes unable\nto move.
Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but\nSpinda thinks it’s walking in a straight line.
Each and every Spinda has a slightly different\nconfiguration of spots. There are collectors who\nenjoy the tiny differences in their spot patterns.
Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a\nlong time makes it feel sick.
Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its\nstumbling movements, it evades opponents’\nattacks brilliantly!
It can live for a week without eating a thing.\nIt waits patiently at the bottom of its nest for\nprey to appear.
As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws\ncrush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds\na funnel-shaped nest.
Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but\nso heavy that it can’t get up if it flips over.\nSandile seize those moments as their chance.
It builds nests that double as traps, lying in\nwait for its prey to get caught. When night falls,\nit digs itself a spot beneath the sand to sleep.
Rather than using its underdeveloped wings for\nflight, it rubs them together, producing\nultrasonic waves to attack its enemies.
To help make its wings grow, it dissolves\nquantities of prey in its digestive juices and\nguzzles them down every day.
It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic\nwaves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries\nthe prey alive in the sand to preserve it.
It vibrates its wings to send out odd sound\nwaves. Trainers who are with it need earplugs.
The flapping of its wings sounds something like\nsinging. Those lured by the sound are enveloped\nin a sandstorm, becoming Flygon’s prey.
This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms\nit creates and seldom appears where people\ncan see it.
By flapping their wings, Flygon cause\nsandstorms that conceal Krookodile.\nThe team then splits the prey they catch.
People continue to have their hearts stolen by\nits enchanting songs and find themselves\nstranded in the desert.
Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar.\nEven in muddy waters, it can detect its\nprey’s location.
Its slippery body is hard to grasp, so much so\nthat there are festivals where people compete\nto see how many they can catch barehanded.
Its entire body is gooey. When pecked at by\nbird Pokémon, it slips and slides its way\nto freedom.
Its whiskers are filled with nerves. They can\nsense smells and flavors just as a person’s nose\nor tongue would.
A glutton that devours anything that moves,\nit quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps,\nlying in wait for prey.
Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water\nis believed to herald an earthquake.
Whiscash shakes the ground at high intensities\nto intimidate its opponents. It swallows its prey\nwhole—along with mud from the swamp floor.
Its vision is not that good. It senses vibrations in\nthe water with its whiskers to determine the\nlocation of its prey.
Individuals that have been set free by Trainers\nwho could no longer raise them have become\ncommon, and they can now be found in Alola.
It can adapt very well to its environment.\nFeebas and Corphish are about the only\nPokémon to live in stagnant ditches.
Its temperament is rough and it loves to fight,\nbut as soon as its pincers break off, it turns\ncowardly. It stays timid until they grow back.
Its pincers often fall off. Unlike with Crabrawler\nor Clauncher, the meat in its claws is utterly\nnasty and stinking.
Depictions of Pokémon similar to Baltoy have\nbeen found on the walls of caves where\nprimitive humans lived.
When they find others of their kind, they cry\nout loudly and gather together. Large numbers\nof them can be found in old graveyards.
If it gets wet, its body melts. When rain starts\nto fall, it wraps its whole body up with its\npsychic powers to protect itself.
The ancient people who made it apparently\nmodeled it after something that descended\nfrom the sky. It fires beams from both arms.
In ancient times, it lived in warm seas. It\ndisguised itself as seaweed to ambush its prey\nand devoured them whole when they got close.
It sticks to rocks with its powerful suckers and\ncan’t be washed away no matter how rough the\nsurf gets.
Normally, it lived on shallow sea shoals. When\nthe tide went out, this Pokémon came up on\nland to search for prey.
This carnivorous Pokémon lived in primordial\nseas. It catches prey in its eight tentacles and\ndissolves them with digestive fluid as it eats.
When restored Anorith are released into the\nocean, they don’t thrive, because the water\ncomposition has changed since their era.
This is one kind of primeval bug Pokémon.\nWith eight wings, it could apparently swim\na lot faster than you’d expect.
It lived on land and went out into the sea to\nhunt for prey. Its sharp claws were its\ngreatest weapon.
Armaldo adapted from living in water to living on\nland. It has been determined that it is the\nancestor of some bug Pokémon.
A tough Pokémon that is perfectly fine even\nin dirty water. However, due to its ragged,\nshabby appearance, it isn’t popular.
Although unattractive and unpopular, this\nPokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a\nsubject of research.
They look ragged, so no one catches them. They\nlook like they’d taste bad, so predators won’t\neat them. And their numbers continue to grow.
Because of its wretched appearance, most\npeople pay it no attention, but there are some\nwho collect Feebas—and Feebas alone!
Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists.\nIt has even been referred to as the most\nbeautiful Pokémon of all.
It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of\nwar, it shows itself, which soothes people’s\nminds and hearts.
While Milotic is said to be the most beautiful\nPokémon, Trainers who like Feebas and have\nraised it are seemingly disappointed by Milotic.
Its dwelling place is the bottom of big lakes.\nThose who behold its loveliness are said to\nhave their hearts purified.
It changes its form depending on the weather.\nChanges in the temperature or humidity\nappear to affect its cellular structure.
Its form changes on its own, due to its cells’\nsensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.
Although its form changes with the weather,\nthat is apparently the result of a chemical\nreaction and not the result of its own free will.
Its form changes depending on the weather.\nThe rougher conditions get, the rougher\nCastform’s disposition!
It changes its hue to blend into its surroundings.\nIf no one takes notice of it for too long, it will\npout and never reveal itself.
Its color changes for concealment and also\nwhen its mood or health changes. The darker\nthe color, the healthier it is.
It eats up emotions like malice, jealousy, and\nresentment, so some people are grateful for\nits presence.
There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house\nwhere Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”
It’s a stuffed toy that was thrown away and\nbecame possessed, ever searching for the one\nwho threw it away so it can exact its revenge.
Resentment at being cast off made it spring into\nbeing. Some say that treating it well will satisfy\nit, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.
The bunches of fruit growing around the necks\nof Tropius in Alola are especially sweet\ncompared to those in other regions.
Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck.\nIn warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.
Long ago, superstitions were spread about it,\nsaying it brought disaster. This fed a hatred\nof it, and it was driven deep into the mountains.
Although it’s said to bring disaster, in actuality,\nthis Pokémon possesses a calm disposition and\nwarns people of any crises that loom.
The only thing unlucky about Absol is its\nappearance. It protects fields and warns people\nof disaster, so one ought to be grateful for it.
The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and\ndetest it, but interest in its power to predict\ndisasters is on the rise.
Their numbers seem to have rapidly increased in\nAlola. Custom has it that houses where Snorunt\nlive will be prosperous for generations to come.
It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces\nhappily around, even in environments as cold as\n-150 degrees Fahrenheit.
It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It’s only able to\nsurvive in a limited number of places in the\nwarm Alola region.
Rich people from cold areas all share childhood\nmemories of playing with Snorunt.
Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain\nabsorbed the distress and regrets of a\nstranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.
Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the\ncold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While\nthey’re in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.
It freezes its prey and chews them whole.\nHowever, it prefers to eat Pokémon like Vanillite\nthat are already frozen.
Its actual body is a rock that isn’t particularly\nhard. Glalie absorbs moisture from the air and\ndrapes itself in an armor of ice.
Despite its appearance, it’s carnivorous. It\nclamps down on its prey with both sides of its\nshell and doesn’t let go until they stop moving.
Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious.\nThey can be more than 10 times as costly\nas Shellder’s pearls.
It’s not the strongest swimmer. It wags its tail to\nlure in its prey and then gulps them down as\nsoon as they get close.
Deep seas are their habitat. According to\ntradition, when Huntail wash up onshore,\nsomething unfortunate will happen.
The color of its body changes with the water\ntemperature. The coloration of Gorebyss in Alola\nis almost blindingly vivid.
It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The\nleftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it\nbecomes food for other Pokémon.
Its form has remained the same for one hundred\nmillion years. Its body is filled with fat, so it can\nwithstand the water pressure of the deep sea.
It was fortuitously discovered during a deep sea\nexpedition. Its teeth have atrophied, so it now\nsurvives on microscopic organisms it sucks up.
Thought to have gone extinct, Relicanth was\ngiven a name that is a variation of the name of\nthe person who discovered it.
The reason it hasn’t changed at all in a hundred\nmillion years is that it’s apparently already a\nperfect life-form.
If a Luvdisc is left on its own, it becomes\ndespondent, leaving itself open to attack.\nThat is when Pelipper snatch them up.
Loving couples have a soft spot for this\nPokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release\nthis Pokémon into their pools.
There was an era when it was overfished due to\nthe rumor that having one of its heart-shaped\nscales would enable you to find a sweetheart.
Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm\nseas. It especially likes sleeping in the space\nbetween Corsola’s branches.
Its belief that it will be able to fly one day\nis apparently the influence of information\ncarried in its genes.
With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts\nindiscriminately. This is because of the stress\nit feels at being unable to fly.
Whenever it sees bird Pokémon flying through\nthe sky, it becomes envious and smashes its\nsurroundings to bits with headbutts.
Some theories suggest that its behavior\nof forcefully bashing its head into things\nstimulates cells that affect its evolution.
The cells within its shell transform with\nexplosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
They lurk deep within caves—motionless,\nneither eating nor drinking. Why they don’t die is\nnot known.
The cells within its body are changing at a\nbewildering pace. Its hard shell is made from\nthe same substance as bone.
Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut\nup in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will\nbe able to fly.
When angered, it loses all sense of itself and\ndestroys everything around it. The destruction\nwill continue until Salamence has tired itself out.
It flies around on its wings, which have grown in\nat last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames,\nburning up the fields it passes over.
Overjoyed at finally being able to fly, it flies all\nover the place and usually doesn’t land until it’s\ncompletely exhausted and needs to sleep.
Thanks to its fervent wishes, the cells in its\nbody finally mutated, and at last it has its\nheart’s desire—wings.
Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism\nto communicate with others of its kind.
With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in\nclose. When they’re in range, it slashes them\nwith its rear claws.
Instead of blood, magnetism flows through its\nbody. When it’s feeling bad, try giving it\na magnet.
If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It\nwill also burst out strong magnetism, causing\nnearby machines to break.
When two Beldum link together, their psychic\npower is doubled. Their intelligence, however,\nremains unchanged.
It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues\nNosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
With its two brains, it fires powerful psychic\nenergy to stop its prey in their tracks.
It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it\nfinds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its\nsharp claws and never lets go.
It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and\nlarge body. Then the teeth in the mouth on its\nstomach chew the prey to bits.
A linkage of two Metang, this Pokémon can\nperform any calculation in a flash by utilizing\nparallel processing in its four brains.
It boasts not only psychic powers but also\nfantastic strength. It grabs its prey with its four\nlegs and holds them in place with its claws.
It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy\nthan a supercomputer, which enables it to\ncalmly back them into a corner.
It lived in jungles around a hundred million years\nago. It used its skillful headbutts to\ncombat Aerodactyl.
In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found,\nthe fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two\nare also often found.
A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and\nsturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It\nsnapped trees by headbutting them, and then\nit fed on their ripe berries.
The result of repeated headbutts is a skull\ngrown thick and hard. However, its brain has\nshrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.
Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved\ninto Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and\nthen destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of\nthis Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder\nthan steel, to make helmets.
This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully.\nIts brain was really small, so some theories\nsuggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.
Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found,\nbut almost none have shown signs of damage\nto the face.
This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few\nenemies would have been willing to square off\nagainst its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.
A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used\nits face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on\nits face was plenty tough.
Although its fossils can be found in layers of\nprimeval rock, nothing but its face has ever\nbeen discovered.
While it can guard against any sort of attack\nfrom the front, it is left without recourse when\nattacked from behind.
It lived in the same environments as Rampardos.\nTheir fossils have been found together—\nseemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.
The bones of its face are huge and hard, so\nthey were mistaken for its spine until after this\nPokémon was successfully restored.
This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years\nago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder\nthan steel.
For the most part, it makes its home along\nthe seashore. Its color and form differ according\nto its habitat and the quality of its food.
Purple mucus sticks to the hands of anyone\nwho touches it. Take care, as the substance is\ntroublesome to wash off.
While they normally live in the sea, they can\nfunction on land, too, until their skin dries out.
When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out\nof it. The liquid is thought to be something like\ngreasy sweat.
It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if\nparts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will\nreturn to normal within a few hours.
Plankton, invisible to the naked eye, is its main\nfood source. It comes onto the land periodically,\nbut the reason for this is not known.
Long ago, it had a shell on its back. There’s now\na vestigial plate on its back that’s hard but thin.
Their shape and color change, depending on\ntheir environment and diet. There are many of\nthem at beaches where the waves are calm.
In their search for comfortable trees, they get\ninto territorial disputes with groups of\nPassimian. They win about half the time.
It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both\nof its tails around you and gives you a squeeze,\nthat’s proof it really likes you.
Stories go that it grabs the hands of small\nchildren and drags them away to the afterlife.\nIt dislikes heavy children.
If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills\nout with a screaming sound.
Its round body is stuffed with souls and\nexpands each time it leads someone away.
Wandering souls gathered together to form this\nPokémon. When trying to make friends with\nchildren, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.
There was once an incident in which a man\ntook a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.
Even while under careful observation, large\nflocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably\ndisappear from view.
There’s a rumor that if you catch a Drifblim\nfloating on the wind at dusk, you’ll be carried\naway to the afterlife.
The raw material for the gas inside its body\nis souls. When its body starts to deflate, it’s\nthought to carry away people and Pokémon.
Its arms and legs are weak, but when it rolls its\nears up tight and then unleashes them with its\nfull force, it can smash boulders to dust.
The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it\ncan launch a swift counterattack if it’s attacked\nby an enemy.
Lopunny regrows its coat twice a year. Mufflers\nand hats made from its fur are really warm.
It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting,\nbut at the same time, it can deliver powerful\nkicks with its lithe legs.
It appears as if from nowhere—muttering\nincantations, placing curses, and giving\npeople terrifying visions.
Mismagius have been known to cast spells to\nmake people fall in love, so some people search\nfor this Pokémon as if their life depended on it.
Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads,\nthis Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells\nthat help people.
Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches\nor terrifying visions that torment others.
A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and\nmore than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies\nwill assemble.
If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it,\nor if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt\nthem down wherever they are and punish them.
It will absolutely not forgive failure from or\nbetrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this\nif it wants to maintain the order of the flock.
Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it.\nThe only time it dirties its own hands is in\ndelivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.
It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry\nlocales. Since its surroundings tend to lack\ngreenery, it stands out noticeably.
From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from\nits body. This liquid is similar in composition to\nhuman sweat.
It discharges moisture from its eyes, making it\nlook like it’s crying—apparently an effective way\nof getting enemies to let down their guard.
If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a\nprocess reminiscent of sweating, its eyes\nexpel moisture.
It does its absolute best to mimic the\nmovements and expressions of its opponents,\nbut it’s still not very good at it.
When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent,\nMime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up\nforgetting it was imitating something.
It carries a round white rock in its belly pouch.\nIf it gets along well with someone, it will\nsometimes give that person the rock.
It’s too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate,\nit searches out round white stones.
Usually it’s a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you\ntake its round rock away, it will cry and fuss\nand throw a big old tantrum.
When it sees something round and white,\nHappiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It\nsometimes becomes overloaded and can’t move.
It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.\nEven so, when the weather gets cold, it will\nhuddle close with others of its kind.
It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy\npasses by, it leaps out and chomps them. The\nforce of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it\nand bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it\ndoesn’t care too much.
Its original home is an area much hotter than\nAlola. If you’re planning to live with one, your\nheating bill will soar.
In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales.\nMedicine containing its scales as an ingredient\nwill make a weary body feel invigorated.
Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in\nits cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the\njewels it’s amassed or Carbink it has caught.
It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye\ntrying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes\nfuriously angry and attacks the Sableye.
It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its\nscales can be ground into a powder and used\nas raw materials for traditional medicine.
It can fly at speeds rivaling jet planes.\nIt dives into flocks of bird Pokémon and\ngulps the entire flock down whole.
The protuberances on its head serve as\nsensors. It can even detect distant prey.
It flies at the speed of sound while searching\nfor prey, and it has midair battles with\nSalamence as the two compete for food.
Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind\nresistance—their sharp edges also cause injury\nto any opponent who attacks it.
It needs to consume its own weight in food\nevery day. As far as flavor is concerned,\nit’s indifferent.
When it finds something that looks like it might\nbe edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it\nwhole. That’s why it gets fatter day by day.
It hides food under its long fur, but it\nsometimes forgets about it and causes\na stinky disturbance.
Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on\nand swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough\nto handle it even if the food has gone rotten.
It can discern the physical and emotional states\nof people, Pokémon, and other natural things\nfrom the shape of their aura waves.
It’s tough enough to run right through the night,\nand it’s also a hard worker, but it’s still just\na youngster.
It knows how people and Pokémon feel by\nlooking at their auras. It doesn’t approach\ndangerous opponents.
It uses waves called auras to communicate with\nothers of its kind. It doesn’t make any noise\nduring this time, so its enemies can’t detect it.
Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also\ngained the power to control them. It employs\nthem in battle.
They can detect the species of a living being—\nand its emotions—from over half a mile away.\nThey control auras and hunt their prey in packs.
It concentrates its mental energy and fires off\nmysterious waves called auras, which can crush\nboulders of large size to dust.
Lucario reads its opponent’s feelings with its\naura waves. It finds out things it would rather\nnot know, so it gets stressed out easily.
It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its\nskin, which then shine. This appears to be a\nform of camouflage.
Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps.\nWhen it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull\nswoop down to grab it on the fly.
When night falls, their pink patterns begin to\nshine. They’re popular with divers, so there are\nresorts that feed them to keep them close.
It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays\nnear the surface during the day and moves to\nthe depths when night falls.
With its shining light, it lures its prey close.\nHowever, the light also happens to attract\nferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of\nthe sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in\nsearch of its favorite food—Starmie.
Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is\nscarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with\nLanturn over food.
They traverse the deep waters as if crawling\nover the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its\nfins shine like stars in the night sky.
It’s highly friendly and easily tamed. Tours that\ntake people swimming with Mantyke are a\nsuper-popular beach activity.
Mantyke are friendly toward people and will\napproach boats closely. The patterns on their\nbacks differ depending on their habitat.
They travel in groups of four or five, leaving\nsigns for one another on trees and rocks. They\nbring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main\nfood source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew,\nwhich they carefully divide among their group.
One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it\nover, and then another Weavile will deal the\nfinishing blow with its sharp claws.
Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping\nover food is a thing of the past. A scratch from\nits claws will give you a case of frostbite!
Three units generate magnetism. There have\nbeen many mistaken reports of UFO sightings\nwhen Magnezone flies through the night sky.
As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon\nseems to be receiving signals of unknown origin,\nwhile transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders\nare quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.
There are still people who believe that this\nPokémon came from outer space. It emanates\na powerful magnetic field.
A contest is under way to determine which one\ncan stick its tongue out the farthest. The\ncurrent record is...more than 82 feet.
It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its\nhands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a\nsingle small bean with its tongue.
It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes\nand then lets loose a high-voltage current.\nIts foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With\nevery thud, thunder roars and electric sparks\nshower all around.
